Entries.default:
"Gótvadhjur... ah, you must be our honored guest. Vatnir said to expect you."

The man stands from his fire and brushes his hands together, a smile splitting his patchy ice-colored beard.
"Come, come. Shake off the snow. Warm yourself at the hearth."
"I need supplies."
"I'd like to rent a room."
"You're here because of your beliefs?"
[Leave] "Never mind."
"What I have is yours, for trade or coin. Until the end comes."
"The accommodations are most modest, but as comfortable as a kith could hope."
"Death walks in hand with life in the White that Wends. The priests of the Wheel would have you believe they follow one after the other."
"It is not so."
"Hello again." The man bows slightly at the waist.
"Impressive, your struggle against the beast. Don't take it bad, the resurrection. All things end, ja?"
"Not that he said I should expect so many. No matter! Room will be made!"

"If there is anything you require, you need but ask. I will strive to deliver. Oh, and before I forget, a welcoming gift!"

Valbrendhür rummages among the furs and presses a bundle into your hands.
"Of course. Aren't you?"
"I'm here because Vatnir invited me."
"I don't pray for the end of the world, if that's what you're asking."
"Fair point. I suppose my beliefs brought me here, too."
"Just tell me why you came to this godsforsaken block of ice."
"He cast no summoning spell, no binding rite. Your coming was of your own accord."
"Yet it comes, asked for or no."
The kith sighs and draws a hand down his bearded chin.
"I found a rift once, at the bottom of the world, and in it a camp, a clan's worth of Glamfellen, huddled and still. Their stories, their blood, their ambitions - none persevere."
"I chase not the end, but accept its inevitability. It is a thing to be celebrated, like the ending of an epic finely sung. Vatnir understands that, so I follow his lead."
"A single incident hardly speaks to a fundamental truth." Aloth rubs at his brow and sighs.
"You are correct. Every incident speaks to a fundamental truth."
"The messenger arrives! Hurry atop, lest you miss his majestic fury!"
"Have you seen Vatnir?"
"He's not in the chapel? He didn't follow the others outside, so perhaps try his quarters. They're just down the hall."
The kith sighs and draws a hand down his bearded chin.
